net.sf.wubiq.clients.remotes

Class PrintableChunkRemote

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.wubiq.clients.remotes.PrintableChunkRemote
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.print.Printable, IProxyClient

    public class PrintableChunkRemote
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.print.Printable, IProxyClient
    Wraps a printable object into a serializable class. This object stores the commands sent to a graphic recorder. Because it is serialized, the commands can later be de-serialized into this object.
    Author:
    Federico Alcantara

      • setServerSupportsCompression

        public void setServerSupportsCompression(boolean serverSupportsCompression)

      • print

        public int print(java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                 java.awt.print.PageFormat pageFormat,
                 int pageIndex)
          throws java.awt.print.PrinterException
        This a two stage print method. First it records graphics command into itself by using a GraphicRecorder object. After it is de-serialized, then it sends the previously saved command to the graphics provided by the local printer object.
        Specified by:
        print in interface java.awt.print.Printable
        Throws:
        java.awt.print.PrinterException

      • executeGraphics

        protected void executeGraphics(java.awt.Graphics2D graph,
                               java.awt.print.PageFormat pageFormat,
                               java.util.Set<GraphicCommand> graphicCommands)
        Iterates through the previously serialized command set.
        Parameters:
        graph - Graphics2D object receiving the commands.
        pageFormat - Format of the page to be rendered.
        xScale - new scale to apply horizontally wise.
        yScale - new scale to apply vertically wise.

      • executeMethod

        protected void executeMethod(java.awt.Graphics2D graph,
                             GraphicCommand graphicCommand)
        Validates and perform the graphic command. It unwraps previously wrapped objects and applies the command to the given Graphics2D object.
        Parameters:
        graph - Graphics2D object.
        graphicCommand - Specific graphic command.
